meanings.definition: A unit of currency in South Africa.
meanings.sent1: In South Africa, people use rands to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for rands at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The store only accepted rands, so I had to find a currency exchange.
meanings.sent4: His pockets jingled with rands as he walked down the street.
meanings.sent5: The shiny rands in the cash register caught my eye.

meanings.definition: The edge or border of something.
meanings.sent1: The rands of the table were painted in a bright color.
meanings.sent2: She traced the rands of the map with her finger.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked along the rands of the fence, balancing carefully.
meanings.sent4: The rands of the cliff dropped steeply into the ocean below.
meanings.sent5: The rands of the puzzle pieces fit together perfectly.

meanings.definition: To form an edge or border.
meanings.sent1: She used a ruler to rands the paper before cutting it.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully rands the fabric before sewing.
meanings.sent3: The gardener will rands the flower bed with colorful stones.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to rands the painting with a thin gold frame.
meanings.sent5: The chef likes to rands the plate with a drizzle of sauce.
